trans-unit.source: Results of a hit test. Can be one or more of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Results of a hit test.
Can be one or more of the following values:

target.mrk: Results of a hit test.
Can be one or more of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_ABOVE - The position is above the control's client area

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_ABOVE - The position is above the control's client area

target.mrk: $LVHT_ABOVE - The position is above the control's client area

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_BELOW - The position is below the control's client area

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_BELOW - The position is below the control's client area

target.mrk: $LVHT_BELOW - The position is below the control's client area

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_NOWHERE - The position is inside the client window, but it is not over a list item

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_NOWHERE - The position is inside the client window, but it is not over a list item

target.mrk: $LVHT_NOWHERE - The position is inside the client window, but it is not over a list item

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_ONITEMICON - The position is over an item's icon

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMICON - The position is over an item's icon

target.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMICON - The position is over an item's icon

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_ONITEMLABEL - The position is over an item's text

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMLABEL - The position is over an item's text

target.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMLABEL - The position is over an item's text

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_ONITEMSTATEICON - The position is over the state image of an item

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMSTATEICON - The position is over the state image of an item

target.mrk: $LVHT_ONITEMSTATEICON - The position is over the state image of an item

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_TOLEFT - The position is to the left of the client area

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_TOLEFT - The position is to the left of the client area

target.mrk: $LVHT_TOLEFT - The position is to the left of the client area

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_TORIGHT - The position is to the right of the client area

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_TORIGHT - The position is to the right of the client area

target.mrk: $LVHT_TORIGHT - The position is to the right of the client area

trans-unit.source: For Windows Vista or later:

seg-source.mrk: For Windows Vista or later:

target.mrk: For Windows Vista or later:

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER - The point is within the group header.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER - The point is within the group header.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER - The point is within the group header.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER - The point is within the group footer.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER - The point is within the group footer.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER - The point is within the group footer.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE - The point is within the collapse/expand button of the group.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE - The point is within the collapse/expand button of the group.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE - The point is within the collapse/expand button of the group.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND - The point is within the area of the group where items are displayed.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND - The point is within the area of the group where items are displayed.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND - The point is within the area of the group where items are displayed.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON - The point is within the state icon of the group.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON - The point is within the state icon of the group.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON - The point is within the state icon of the group.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK - The point is within the subset link of the group.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK - The point is within the subset link of the group.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK - The point is within the subset link of the group.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_GROUP - $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP - $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_GROUP - $LVHT_EX_GROUP_BACKGROUND | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_COLLAPSE | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_FOOTER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_HEADER | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_STATEICON | $LVHT_EX_GROUP_SUBSETLINK.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_ONCONTENTS - The point is within the icon or text content of the item and not on the background.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_ONCONTENTS - The point is within the icon or text content of the item and not on the background.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_ONCONTENTS - The point is within the icon or text content of the item and not on the background.

trans-unit.source: $LVHT_EX_FOOTER - The point is within the footer of the list-view control.

seg-source.mrk: $LVHT_EX_FOOTER - The point is within the footer of the list-view control.

target.mrk: $LVHT_EX_FOOTER - The point is within the footer of the list-view control.

trans-unit.source: Receives the index of the matching item. Or if hit-testing a subitem, this value represents the subitem's parent item.

seg-source.mrk: Receives the index of the matching item.
Or if hit-testing a subitem, this value represents the subitem's parent item.

target.mrk: Receives the index of the matching item.
Or if hit-testing a subitem, this value represents the subitem's parent item.

trans-unit.source: Receives the index of the matching subitem. When hit-testing an item, this member will be zero.

seg-source.mrk: Receives the index of the matching subitem.
When hit-testing an item, this member will be zero.

target.mrk: Receives the index of the matching subitem.
When hit-testing an item, this member will be zero.

trans-unit.source: Group index of the item hit (read only). Valid only for owner data. If the point is within an item that is displayed in multiple groups then iGroup will specify the group index of the item Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: Group index of the item hit (read only).
Valid only for owner data.
If the point is within an item that is displayed in multiple groups then iGroup will specify the group index of the item Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: Group index of the item hit (read only).
Valid only for owner data.
If the point is within an item that is displayed in multiple groups then iGroup will specify the group index of the item Windows Vista or later.
